description: Documentation for 5. State Spaces, Types, and Variables

directories.name: 51_state_spaces
directories.description: A state space is a storage area with particular characteristics. All variables reside in some state space. The characteristics of a state space include its size, addressability, access speed, access rights, and level of sharing between threads.

directories.name: 53_texture_sampler_and_surface_types
directories.description: PTX includes built-in *opaque* types for defining texture, sampler, and surface descriptor variables. directories.name: 54_variables
directories.description: In PTX, a variable declaration describes both the variable’s type and its state space. In addition to fundamental types, PTX supports types for simple aggregate objects such as vectors and arrays.

files.title: Overview
files.summary: While the specific resources available in a given target GPU will vary, the kinds of resources will be common across platforms, and these resources are abstracted in PTX through state spaces and data types.
